translated: Stories of Departed Spirits
The Great Chapter
. The Story of the Two Young Men
“The city named Sāvatthī,
facing the Himalayas,
There were two young men,
sons of kings, I have heard.
They were right in their desires,🔽enjoying the pleasures of the senses,
greedy for the happiness of the present,
they did not see the future.
When they died and passed on from this world,
they went to the next world.
There they lamented,
their former misdeeds.
“When there were many people,
and gifts were being given,
we were not able to make
a small offering that would bring happiness.
What could be worse than that,
that we, having died in the royal family,
were reborn in the ghost realm,
afflicted with hunger and thirst?
Having been masters here,
we are now without a master there;
we wander about hungry and thirsty,
people are high and low.

analyzed: etam ādīnavam ñatvā  issara mada sambhava
translated: Knowing this danger,🔽arising from the intoxication of power,
having given up the intoxication of power,
a man goes to heaven in his next life;
when the body breaks up, the wise one,
he is reborn in heaven.”
The Story of the Young Man’s Ghost is the sixth.
